items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: client_config_priority
items.description: The priority level that the client configuration will have in the Alternatives system on the hosts. Higher priority levels will cause Alternatives to prefer this configuration over any others.

items.name: client_config_root_dir
items.description: The directory where the client configs will be deployed

items.name: hive_metastore_timeout
items.description: Timeout for requests to the Hive Metastore Server. Consider increasing this if you have tables with a lot of metadata and see timeout errors. Used by most Hive Metastore clients such as Hive CLI and HiveServer2, but not by Impala. Impala has a separately configured timeout.

items.name: hive_client_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Gateway Client Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hive-env.sh
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into the client configuration for hive-env.sh

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Gateway logs

items.name: hive_client_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Client Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hive-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into the client configuration for hive-site.xml.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: Gateway Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: hive_client_java_opts
items.description: These are Java command line arguments. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: hive_client_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Client Java Heap Size in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: hive_log_dir
items.description: Directory where Hive Metastore Server will place its log files.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for Hive Metastore Server logs

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: hive_metastore_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Server Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hive-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hive-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: hivemetastore_scm_health_enabled
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Server Process Health Test
items.description: Enables the health test that the Hive Metastore Server's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: hivemetastore_host_health_enabled
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Server Host Health Test
items.description: When computing the overall Hive Metastore Server health, consider the host's health.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: hive_metastore_delegation_token_store
items.description: The delegation token store implementation class. Use DBTokenStore for Highly Available Metastore Configuration.

items.name: hive_metastore_port
items.description: Port on which Hive Metastore Server will listen for connections.

items.name: hivemetastore_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: hive_metastore_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Server Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Server Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: max_log_size
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Server Max Log Size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for Hive Metastore Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: hive_metastore_max_threads
items.description: Maximum number of worker threads in the Hive Metastore Server's thread pool

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: hive_metastore_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of Hive Metastore Server in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Server Maximum Log File Backups
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for Hive Metastore Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: hive_metastore_min_threads
items.description: Minimum number of worker threads in the Hive Metastore Server's thread pool

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: metastore_canary_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that checks that basic Hive Metastore operations succeed

items.name: hive_metastore_java_opts
items.displayName: Java Configuration Options for Hive Metastore Server
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: hiveserver2_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of HiveServer2 in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_driver_memory
items.displayName: Spark Driver Maximum Java Heap Size
items.description: Maximum size of each Spark driver's Java heap memory when Hive is running on Spark.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_dynamic_allocation_enabled
items.description: When enabled, Spark will add and remove executors dynamically to Hive jobs. This is done based on the workload.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_dynamic_allocation_initial_executors
items.description: Initial number of executors used by the application at any given time. This is required if the dynamic executor allocation feature is enabled.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_dynamic_allocation_min_executors
items.displayName: Lower Bound on Number of Executors
items.description: Lower bound on the number of executors used by the application at any given time. This is used by dynamic executor allocation

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_executor_cores
items.description: Number of cores per Spark executor.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_executor_instances
items.description: Number of Spark executors assigned to each application. This should not be set when Dynamic Executor Allocation is enabled.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_executor_memory
items.displayName: Spark Executor Maximum Java Heap Size
items.description: Maximum size of each Spark executor's Java heap memory when Hive is running on Spark.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_yarn_driver_memory_overhead
items.description: This is the amount of extra off-heap memory that can be requested from YARN, per driver. This, together with spark.driver.memory, is the total memory that YARN can use to create JVM for a driver process.

items.name: hiveserver2_spark_yarn_executor_memory_overhead
items.description: This is the amount of extra off-heap memory that can be requested from YARN, per executor process. This, together with spark.executor.memory, is the total memory that YARN can use to create JVM for an executor process.

items.name: hive_log_dir
items.description: Directory where HiveServer2 will place its log files.

items.name: hiveserver2_enable_mapjoin
items.description: Enable optimization that converts common join into MapJoin based on input file size.

items.name: hs2_thrift_address_port
items.description: Port on which HiveServer2 will listen for connections.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for HiveServer2 logs

items.name: hiveserver2_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: hiverserver2_load_balancer
items.description: Address of the load balancer used for HiveServer2 roles, specified in host:port format. If port is not specified, the port used by HiveServer2 is used. Note: Changing this property regenerates Kerberos keytabs for all HiveServer2 roles.

items.name: hiveserver2_enable_explain_output
items.description: When enabled, HiveServer2 logs EXPLAIN EXTENDED output for every query at INFO log4j level.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: hiveserver2_merge_mapfiles
items.displayName: Enable Merging Small Files - Map-Only Job
items.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-only job. When enabled, a map-only job is created to merge the files in the destination table/partitions.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: hiveserver2_optimize_index_filter
items.description: Whether to use the indexing optimization for all queries.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: hiveserver2_merge_mapredfiles
items.displayName: Enable Merging Small Files - Map-Reduce Job
items.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-reduce job. When enabled, a map-only job is created to merge the files in the destination table/partitions.

items.name: hiveserver2_exec_local_scratchdir
items.description: Local Directory where Hive stores jars and data when performing a MapJoin optimization. If not specified, Hive uses a default location.

items.name: hiveserver2_optimize_bucketmapjoin_sortedmerge
items.displayName: Hive Optimize Sorted Merge Bucket Join
items.description: Whether to try sorted merge bucket (SMB) join.

items.name: hiveserver2_max_threads
items.description: Maximum number of worker threads in HiveServer2's thread pool

items.name: hiveserver2_optimize_reducededuplication_min_reducer
items.description: When the number of ReduceSink operators after merging is less than this number, the ReduceDeDuplication optimization will be disabled.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: HiveServer2 Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for HiveServer2 logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: hiveserver2_map_aggr
items.description: Enable map-side partial aggregation, which cause the mapper to generate fewer rows. This reduces the data to be sorted and distributed to reducers.

items.name: hiveserver2_exec_local_scratch_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Hive Local Scratch Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's Local Directory where Hive stores jars and data when performing a MapJoin optimization. If not specified, Hive uses a default location.. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Local Directory where Hive stores jars and data when performing a MapJoin optimization. If not specified, Hive uses a default location. Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: hive_hs2_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: HiveServer2 Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hive-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hive-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: hiveserver2_downloaded_resources_dir
items.description: Local directory where Hive stores jars downloaded for remote file systems (HDFS). If not specified, Hive uses a default location.

items.name: hiveserver2_optimize_reducededuplication
items.description: Remove extra map-reduce jobs if the data is already clustered by the same key, eliminating the need to repartition the dataset again.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: hiveserver2_idle_session_timeout
items.description: Session will be closed when not accessed for this duration of time, in milliseconds; disable by setting to zero or a negative value.

items.name: hiveserver2_limit_pushdown_memory_usage
items.description: The max percentage of heap to be used for hash in ReduceSink operator for Top-K selection. A 0 means the optimization is disabled. Values accepted are between 0 and 1.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for HiveServer2 logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: hiveserver2_fetch_task_conversion_threshold
items.description: Above this size, queries will not be converted to fetch tasks.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: hiveserver2_smbjoin_cache_rows
items.description: The number of rows with the same key value to be cached in memory per SMB-joined table.

items.name: hiveserver2_exec_scratchdir
items.description: Directory in HDFS where Hive writes intermediate data between MapReduce jobs. If not specified, Hive uses a default location.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: hiveserver2_compute_query_using_stats
items.description: Enable optimization that checks if a query can be answered using statistics. If so, answers the query using only statistics stored in metastore.

items.name: hiveserver2_map_aggr_hash_memory_ratio
items.displayName: Ratio of Memory Usage for Map-Side Aggregation
items.description: Portion of total memory used in map-side partial aggregation. When exceeded, the partially aggregated results will be flushed from the map task to the reducers.

items.name: hiveserver2_stats_fetch_column_stats
items.description: Whether column stats for a table are fetched during explain.

items.name: hive_hs2_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: HiveServer2 Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: hiveserver2_merge_size_per_task
items.description: The desired file size after merging. This should be larger than hive.merge.smallfiles.avgsize.

items.name: hiveserver2_optimize_sort_dynamic_partition
items.description: When dynamic partition is enabled, reducers keep only one record writer at all times, which lowers the memory pressure on reducers.

items.name: hiveserver2_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the HiveServer2's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: hiveserver2_merge_smallfiles_avgsize
items.displayName: Small File Average Size Merge Threshold
items.description: When the average output file size of a job is less than the value of this property, Hive will start an additional map-only job to merge the output files into bigger files. This is only done for map-only jobs if hive.merge.mapfiles is true, for map-reduce jobs if hive.merge.mapredfiles is true, and for Spark jobs if hive.merge.sparkfiles is true.

items.name: hiveserver2_vectorized_groupby_flush_ratio
items.description: Ratio between 0.0 and 1.0 of entries in the vectorized group-by aggregation hash that is flushed when the memory threshold is exceeded.

items.name: hiveserver2_vectorized_reduce_enabled
items.description: Whether to vectorize the reduce side of query execution.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: hiveserver2_enable_cbo
items.displayName: Enable Cost Based Optimizer for Hive
items.description: Enabled the Calcite based Cost Based Optimizer for HiveServer2.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: hiveserver2_exec_local_scratch_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Hive Local Scratch Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's Local Directory where Hive stores jars and data when performing a MapJoin optimization. If not specified, Hive uses a default location..

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: hiveserver2_vectorized_groupby_checkinterval
items.description: In vectorized group-by, the number of row entries added to the hash table before re-checking average variable size for memory usage estimation.

items.name: hiveserver2_min_threads
items.description: Minimum number of worker threads in HiveServer2's thread pool

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: hiveserver2_fetch_task_conversion
items.description: Some select queries can be converted to a single FETCH task instead of MapReduce task, minimizing latency. A value of none disables all conversion, minimal converts simple queries such as SELECT * and filter on partition columns, and more will convert SELECT queries including FILTERS.

items.name: hiveserver2_enable_impersonation
items.description: HiveServer2 will impersonate the beeline client user when talking to other services such as Mapreduce and Hdfs.

items.name: hiveserver2_vectorized_enabled
items.description: Enable optimization that vectorizes query execution by streamlining operations by processing a block of 1024 rows at a time.

items.name: hiveserver2_idle_operation_timeout
items.description: Operation will be closed when not accessed for this duration of time, in milliseconds; disable by setting to zero. For a positive value, checked for operations in terminal state only (FINISHED, CANCELED, CLOSED, ERROR). For a negative value, checked for all of the operations regardless of state.

items.name: hiveserver2_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall HiveServer2 health, consider the host's health.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: hiveserver2_session_check_interval
items.description: The check interval for session/operation timeout, in milliseconds, which can be disabled by setting to zero or a negative value.

items.name: hiveserver2_auto_convert_join_noconditionaltask_size
items.displayName: Hive Auto Convert Join Noconditional Size
items.description: If Hive auto convert join is on, and the sum of the size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than the specified size, the join is directly converted to a MapJoin (there is no conditional task).

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: hiveserver2_java_opts
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: hiveserver2_merge_sparkfiles
items.displayName: Enable Merging Small Files - Spark Job
items.description: Merge small files at the end of a Spark job. When enabled, a map-only job is created to merge the files in the destination table/partitions.

items.name: hive_webhcat_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: WebHCat Server Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: webhcat_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for WebHCat Server logs

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: webhcat_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall WebHCat Server health, consider the host's health.

items.name: webhcat_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the WebHCat Server's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: hive_webhcat_hive_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: WebHCat Server Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hive-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hive-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: hive_webhcat_java_opts
items.displayName: Java Configuration Options for WebHCat Server
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: hive_webhcat_address_port
items.description: Port on which WebHCat Server will listen for connections.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: WebHCat Server Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for WebHCat Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: hive_webhcat_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: WebHCat Server Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for webhcat-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into webhcat-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: hive_webhcat_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of WebHCat Server in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.displayName: WebHCat Server Maximum Log File Backups
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for WebHCat Server logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: hcatalog_log_dir
items.description: Directory where WebHCat Server will place its log files.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: enable_hive_on_spark
items.description: Cloudera does not support Hive on Spark in CDH 5.4. Enable Hive to use Spark for execution even though it is not supported. For evaluation purposes only. This configuration only takes effect when Hive is configured with a Spark On YARN Service. See Configuring Hive on Spark for more information about using Hive on Spark.

items.name: hive_bytes_per_reducer
items.description: Size per reducer. If the input size is 10GiB and this is set to 1GiB, Hive will use 10 reducers.

items.name: hive_metastore_database_host
items.description: Host name of Hive Metastore database

items.name: hive_metastore_database_name
items.description: Name of Hive Metastore database

items.name: hive_metastore_database_password
items.description: Password for Hive Metastore database

items.name: hive_metastore_database_port
items.description: Port number of Hive Metastore database

items.name: hive_metastore_database_type
items.description: Type of Hive Metastore database. Note that Derby is not recommended and Cloudera Impala does not support Derby.

items.name: mapreduce_yarn_service
items.description: MapReduce jobs are run against this service.

items.name: spark_on_yarn_service
items.description: Name of the Spark on YARN service that this Hive service instance depends on. If selected and Enable Hive on Spark is set to true, Hive jobs can use the Spark execution engine instead of MapReduce2. Requires that Hive depends on YARN. See Configuring Hive on Spark for more information about Hive on Spark.

items.name: zookeeper_service
items.description: Name of the ZooKeeper service that this Hive service instance depends on.
items.validationMessage: Hive will use ZooKeeper to guard against corruption in concurrency scenarios. This ZooKeeper may be configured in Hive configuration or in a dependency such as HDFS.

items.name: audit_event_log_dir
items.description: Path to the directory where audit logs will be written. The directory will be created if it doesn't exist.

items.name: hive_warehouse_directory
items.description: Hive warehouse directory is the location in HDFS where Hive's tables are stored. Note that Hive's default value for its warehouse directory is '/user/hive/warehouse'.
items.validationMessage: The value /user/hive/warehouse for Hive Warehouse Directory is not being used elsewhere.

items.name: smon_derived_configs_safety_valve
items.displayName: Service Monitor Derived Configs Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a list of derived configuration properties that will be used by the Service Monitor instead of the default ones.

items.name: sentry_metastore_service_users
items.description: List of users that are allowed to bypass Sentry Authorization in the Hive metastore. These are usually service users that already ensure that all activity has been authorized, such as hive and impala. Only applies when Hive is using Sentry Service.

items.name: hiveserver2_truststore_password
items.displayName: HiveServer2 TLS/SSL Certificate Trust Store Password
items.description: The password for the HiveServer2 TLS/SSL Certificate Trust Store File. Note that this password is not required to access the trust store: this field can be left blank. This password provides optional integrity checking of the file. The contents of trust stores are certificates, and certificates are public information.

items.name: hive_sentry_provider
items.displayName: Sentry User to Group Mapping Class
items.description: The class to use in Sentry authorization for user to group mapping. Sentry authorization may be configured to use either Hadoop user to group mapping or local groups defined in the policy file. Hadoop user to group mapping may be configured in the Cloudera Manager HDFS service configuration page under the Security section.

items.name: hive_max_reducers
items.description: Max number of reducers to use. If the configuration parameter Hive Reduce Tasks is negative, Hive will limit the number of reducers to the value of this parameter.

items.name: navigator_event_tracker
items.description:
Configures the rules for event tracking and coalescing. This feature is used to define equivalency between different audit events. When events match, according to a set of configurable parameters, only one entry in the audit list is generated for all the matching events.

Tracking works by keeping a reference to events when they first appear, and comparing other incoming events against the "tracked" events according to the rules defined here.

Event trackers are defined in a JSON object like the following:

{
  "timeToLive" : [integer],
  "fields" : [
    {
      "type" : [string],
      "name" : [string]
    }
  ]
}

Where:

  • timeToLive: maximum amount of time an event will be tracked, in milliseconds. Must be provided. This defines how long, since it's first seen, an event will be tracked. A value of 0 disables tracking.
  • fields: list of fields to compare when matching events against tracked events.

Each field has an evaluator type associated with it. The evaluator defines how the field data is to be compared. The following evaluators are available:

  • value: uses the field value for comparison.
  • userName: treats the field value as a userNname, and ignores any host-specific data. This is useful for environment using Kerberos, so that only the principal name and realm are compared.

The following is the list of fields that can be used to compare Hive events:

  • operation: the Hive operation being performed.
  • username: the user performing the action.
  • ipAddress: the IP from where the request originated.
  • allowed: whether the operation was allowed or denied.
  • databaseName: the database affected by the operation.
  • tableName: the table or view affected by the operation.
  • objectType: the type of object affected by the operation.
  • resourcePath: the path of the resource affected by the operation.

items.name: hive_server2_sentry_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for sentry-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into sentry-site.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: hive_proxy_user_groups_list
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Access Control and Proxy User Groups Override
items.description: This configuration overrides the value set for Hive Proxy User Groups configuration in HDFS service for use by Hive Metastore Server. Specify a comma-delimited list of groups that you want to allow access to Hive Metastore metadata and allow the Hive user to impersonate. A value of '*' allows all groups. The default value of empty inherits the value set for Hive Proxy User Groups configuration in the HDFS service.
items.validationMessage: Hive Proxy Groups is configured correctly to enable monitoring by Cloudera Manager Service Monitor.

items.name: hiveserver2_truststore_file
items.displayName: HiveServer2 TLS/SSL Certificate Trust Store File
items.description: The location on disk of the trust store, in .jks format, used to confirm the authenticity of TLS/SSL servers that HiveServer2 might connect to. This is used when HiveServer2 is the client in a TLS/SSL connection. This trust store must contain the certificate(s) used to sign the service(s) being connected to. If this parameter is not provided, the default list of well-known certificate authorities is used instead.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this service reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: hiveserver2_keystore_password
items.displayName: HiveServer2 TLS/SSL Server JKS Keystore File Password
items.description: The password for the HiveServer2 JKS keystore file.

items.name: hive_hiveserver2s_healthy_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the overall HiveServer2 health. The check returns "Concerning" health if the percentage of "Healthy" HiveServer2s falls below the warning threshold. The check is unhealthy if the total percentage of "Healthy" and "Concerning" HiveServer2s falls below the critical threshold.

items.name: navigator_audit_enabled
items.description: Enable collection of audit events from the service's roles.

items.name: hiveserver2_keystore_path
items.displayName: HiveServer2 TLS/SSL Server JKS Keystore File Location
items.description: The path to the TLS/SSL keystore file containing the server certificate and private key used for TLS/SSL. Used when HiveServer2 is acting as a TLS/SSL server. The keystore must be in JKS format.

items.name: service_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this service. This is a JSON formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has all of the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific service.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger will not be evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here may lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the followig JSON formatted trigger fires if there are more than 10 DataNodes with more than 500 file-descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleType = DataNode and last(fd_open) > 500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 10, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change in the future and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases at this time.

items.name: kerberos_princ_name
items.description: Kerberos principal short name used by all roles of this service.

items.name: navigator_audit_event_filter
items.description:
Event filters are defined in a JSON object like the following: 

{
  "defaultAction" : ("accept", "discard"),
  "rules" : [
    {
      "action" : ("accept", "discard"),
      "fields" : [
        {
          "name" : "fieldName",
          "match" : "regex"
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

A filter has a default action and a list of rules, in order of precedence. Each rule defines an action, and a list of fields to match against the audit event.

A rule is "accepted" if all the listed field entries match the audit event. At that point, the action declared by the rule is taken.

If no rules match the event, the default action is taken. Actions default to "accept" if not defined in the JSON object.

The following is the list of fields that can be filtered for Hive events:

  • userName: the user performing the action.
  • ipAddress: the IP from where the request originated.
  • operation: the Hive operation being performed.
  • databaseName: the databaseName for the operation.
  • tableName: the tableName for the operation.

The default Hive audit event filter discards HDFS directory events generated by Hive jobs that reference the /tmp directory.

items.name: hiveserver2_enable_ldap_auth
items.description: When checked, LDAP-based authentication for users is enabled. This option is incompatible with Kerberos authentication for Hive Server 2 at this time.

items.name: hive_aux_jars_path_dir
items.description: Directory containing auxiliary JARs used by Hive. This should be a directory location and not a classpath containing one or more JARs. This directory must be created and managed manually on Hive CLI or HiveServer2 host. The directory location is set in the environment as HIVE_AUX_JARS_PATH and will generally override hive.aux.jars.path property set in XML files, even if hive.aux.jars.path is set in an advanced configuration snippet.

items.name: hiveserver2_ldap_basedn
items.description: When set, this parameter is used to convert the username into the LDAP Distinguished Name (DN), so that the resulting DN looks like uid=username,X. For example, if this parameter is set to "ou=People,dc=cloudera,dc=com", and the username passed in is "mike", the resulting authentication passed to the LDAP server will look like "uid=mike,ou=People,dc=cloudera,dc=com". This parameter is generally most useful when authenticating against an OpenLDAP server. This parameter is mutually exclusive with LDAP Domain.

items.name: hive_reduce_tasks
items.description: Default number of reduce tasks per job. Usually set to a prime number close to the number of available hosts. Ignored when mapred.job.tracker is "local". Hadoop sets this to 1 by default, while Hive uses -1 as the default. When set to -1, Hive will automatically determine an appropriate number of reducers for each job.

items.name: hive_webhcats_healthy_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the overall WebHCat Server health. The check returns "Concerning" health if the percentage of "Healthy" WebHCat Servers falls below the warning threshold. The check is unhealthy if the total percentage of "Healthy" and "Concerning" WebHCat Servers falls below the critical threshold.

items.name: hive_service_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Service Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: hive_metastore_database_datanucleus_metadata_validation
items.displayName: Hive Metastore Database DataNucleus Metadata Validation
items.description: Perform DataNucleus validation of metadata during startup. Note: when enabled, Hive will log DataNucleus warnings even though Hive will function normally.

items.name: navigator_client_max_num_audit_log
items.displayName: Number of Audit Logs to Retain
items.description: Maximum number of rolled over audit logs to retain. The logs will not be deleted if they contain audit events that have not yet been propagated to Audit Server.

items.name: hive_exec_copyfile_maxsize
items.description: Smaller than this size, Hive uses a single-threaded copy; larger than this size, Hive uses DistCp.

items.name: hiveserver2_ldap_domain
items.description: When set, this value will be appended to all usernames before authenticating with the LDAP server. For example, if this parameter is set to "my.domain.com" and the user authenticating is "mike", then "mike@my.domain.com" will be passed to the LDAP server. If this field is unset, the username will remain unaltered before being passed to the LDAP server. LDAP Domain is most useful when authenticating against an Active Directory server. This parameter is mutually exclusive with LDAP BaseDN.

items.name: hiveserver2_ldap_uri
items.description: The URI of the LDAP server to use if LDAP authentication is enabled. The URI must be prefixed with ldap:// or ldaps://. Usernames and passwords will go over the wire in the clear unless an "ldaps://" URI is specified. The URI can optionally specify the port, for example: ldaps://ldap_server.example.com:636.

items.name: hive_metastore_schema_verification
items.description: Prevent Metastore operations in the event of schema version incompatibility. Consider setting this to true to reduce probability of schema corruption during Metastore operations. Note that setting this property to true will also set datanucleus.autoCreateSchema property to false and datanucleus.fixedDatastore property to true. Any values set in Cloudera Manager for these properties will be overridden.

items.name: navigator_audit_log_max_file_size
items.description: Maximum size of audit log file in MB before it is rolled over.

items.name: process_groupname
items.description: The group that this service's processes should run as.

items.name: navigator_client_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Client Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for navigator.client.properties
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into the client configuration for navigator.client.properties.

items.name: smon_client_config_overrides
items.description: For advanced use only, a list of configuration properties that will be used by the Service Monitor instead of the current client configuration for the service.

items.name: hive_bypass_metastore_server
items.description: Instead of talking to Hive Metastore Server for Metastore information, Hive clients will talk directly to the Metastore database.

items.name: sentry_allow_uri_db_policyfile
items.displayName: Allow URIs in Database Policy File
items.description: Allows URIs when defining privileges in per-database policy files. Warning: Typically, this configuration should be disabled. Enabling it would allow database policy file owner (which is generally not Hive admin user) to grant load privileges to any directory with read access to Hive admin user, including databases controlled by other database policy files.

items.name: navigator_audit_queue_policy
items.description: Action to take when the audit event queue is full. Drop the event or shutdown the affected process.

items.name: sentry_enabled
items.displayName: Enable Sentry Authorization using Policy Files
items.description: Use Sentry to enable role-based, fine-grained authorization. This configuration enables Sentry using policy files. To enable Sentry using the Sentry service instead, add the Sentry service as a dependency to the Hive service. The Sentry service provides concurrent and secure access to authorization policy metadata and is the recommended option for enabling Sentry. Sentry is supported only on CDH 4.4 or later deployments. Before enabling Sentry, read the requirements and configuration steps in Setting Up Hive Authorization with Sentry.

items.name: hive_metastore_database_auto_create_schema
items.displayName: Auto Create and Upgrade Hive Metastore Database Schema
items.description: Automatically create or upgrade tables in the Hive Metastore database when needed. Consider setting this to false and managing the schema manually.

items.name: hive_set_ugi
items.description: In unsecure mode, setting this property to true will cause the Metastore Server to execute DFS operations using the client's reported user and group permissions. Cloudera Manager will set this for all clients and servers.

items.name: hiveserver2_enable_ssl
items.description: Encrypt communication between clients and HiveServer2 using Transport Layer Security (TLS) (formerly known as Secure Socket Layer (SSL)).

items.name: hive_hivemetastores_healthy_thresholds
items.displayName: Healthy Hive Metastore Server Monitoring Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the overall Hive Metastore Server health. The check returns "Concerning" health if the percentage of "Healthy" Hive Metastore Servers falls below the warning threshold. The check is unhealthy if the total percentage of "Healthy" and "Concerning" Hive Metastore Servers falls below the critical threshold.

items.name: hive_service_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for hive-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into hive-site.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: hive_metastore_database_user
items.description: User for Hive Metastore database

items.name: hive_core_site_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hive Service Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for core-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into core-site.xml. Applies to configurations of all roles in this service except client configuration.

items.name: hive_sentry_provider_resource
items.description: HDFS path to the global policy file for Sentry authorization. This should be a relative path (and not a full HDFS URL). The global policy file must be in Sentry policy file format.

items.name: process_username
items.description: The user that this service's processes should run as.

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: hive_metastore_derby_path
items.description: Directory name where Hive Metastore's database is stored (only for Derby)

items.name: sentry_service
items.description: Name of the Sentry service that this Hive service instance depends on. If selected, Hive uses this Sentry service to look up authorization privileges. Before enabling Sentry, read the requirements and configuration steps in Setting Up The Sentry Service.

items.name: hive_sentry_server
items.description: The server name used when defining privilege rules in Sentry authorization. Sentry uses this name as an alias for the Hive service. It does not correspond to any physical server name.

items.name: hive_warehouse_subdir_inherit_perms
items.description: Let the table directories inherit the permission of the Warehouse or Database directory instead of being created with the permissions derived from dfs umask. This allows Impala to insert into tables created via Hive.
